text: WHOA this is great. I've never played a single Wild Arms game -- in fact, I'd never heard of the series until I found SupraDarky's playlists -- but they're clearly blessed with fantastic tunes.
author: Cinebeast

text: Most of this playlist is obscure JRPGs. Wild Arms is actually one of the better known ones. I think most people find out about it through Supra - Best VGM 01 is the Town theme from WA1, after all.
author: SiegeSquirrel 42

text: I never heard of this series until an anime called Symphogear! Fell in love with Symphogear's music... so I searched for more of the group ELEMENT GARDEN's work... and here I am! Definitely check out Symphogear if you enjoy this kind of music.

text: I was listening to the list in the background, when this suddenly came up. I immediately recognized it as Wild Arms, even though I have never played any of the games. It's just that your list has shown me how awesomely amazing the Wild Arms music is!

author: Brainstrain91

text:
@SupraDarky Then it sounds like perhaps it could take the FF route(after their creator left after 10), but it all depends on who stays on the team. Afterall, most of the Chrono Trigger team wasn't on board for Radical Dreamers or Chrono Cross yet those were still good because the lead storey man Masato Kato and the composer Yasunori Mitsuda stuck around and are admist the only 6 to have been with the whole series.
Just have to wait for Sony to get into the old school habit.(everyone does)
author: Arc13

text: OMG ... this so awesome music ...
author: Alisashi99

text: @Arc13 Yeah it's not officially dead, which is why I can still hope for a WA6. The news that really started this whole "Could Wild Arms be dead?" discussion was when Akifumi Kaneko, the creator of the series, left Media Vision to start his own company.
author: SupraDarky

text: Wow. That was pretty damn awesome haha def liked the flamenco sound to it :)
author: Raukuu

text: @bregowine Playstation Network has it available for download for only $5-6. Guarenteed, cheap, HD, it's a good way to get it. Same rules apply to Wild Arms 2 as well. However 3,4,and 5 are PS2 so you won't find those on there. But yeah, look for most any Sony made game from the PS1 generation and you'll find it there. Only exception I think is Legend Of Dragoon, that's more of a "good luck" in terms of finding it.
author: Arc13

text: @SupraDarky I don't think you read my comment earlier. Please refer to your latest uploading from Wild Arms 4 Port Ailinton & look for the most liked comment. If you don't feel like going over there for a long description, "No series is ever truly dead." It's all a matter of how long it is between entries. I've noticed a nice little pattern every company takes. Let a series die(a series, not a single entry game), and then it gets revived 10 years later. For some reason 10 is the magic number.
author: Arc13

author: TheSeer

text: I'm playing this game for the first time, very solid so far. Fun battle system, nice dungeons and their puzzles, an overworld and of course a great soundtrack. I do miss Naruke's contribution though. As I go through it I can't help but think this might be the last new WA game I ever play. I really hope we see a WA6 someday.
author: SupraDarky
